name: SQL Injection
description: SQLi occurs when untrusted input is inserted into a SQL query without proper sanitization, allowing attackers to manipulate queries.
prevention: Use prepared statements, parameterized queries, and input validation.
simulation: Imagine a login form where you enter `' OR '1'='1` as a username. The server might run: `SELECT * FROM users WHERE username = '' OR '1'='1'`, which returns all users and bypasses authentication.

name: Cross-Site Scripting
description: XSS allows attackers to inject malicious scripts into web pages viewed by other users.
prevention: Escape user input, use Content Security Policy (CSP), and validate input.
simulation: An attacker posts `<script>alert('Hacked!')</script>` in a comment box. When another user views the page, the script runs in their browser, stealing session cookies.
